program_name: Workplace Innovation and Productivity Skills Incentive (WIPSI)

application_structure.proposal_document: 10-section detailed proposal (narrative document attached to application)

application_questions.title: Organization Information
questions: Organization Type (Government, Private – For Profit, Private – Not For Profit)

application_questions.title: Organization Additional Information
questions: Organization Mandate (describe organization, product lines/services, unique features)

application_questions.title: Organization Address
questions: Does your civic address differ from your mailing address? (Yes/No)

application_questions.title: Organization Contact Information
questions: Checkbox: I understand the role and agree to be the LaMPSS access administrator for this organization.

application_questions.title: Direct Deposit Information
questions: Are you ready to set up the direct deposit now? (Yes/No)
Provide VOID cheque and Nova Scotia Direct Deposit Authorization Form

application_questions.title: Sales and Revenue Information
questions: Total Net Sales for last fiscal year (CAD)
Revenue Sources (Inside Nova Scotia, Other Provinces/Territories, Outside Canada)
Approximate % of revenue from outside NS (0–15%, 16–25%, 26–50%, 51–100%)
Is 30% of your revenue generated through Eligible commercial activity? (Yes/No)

application_questions.title: Additional Funding
questions: Have you received funding from other sources in the past 12 months? (Yes/No)
application_questions.note: This relates to stacking rules - program does not fund training already funded by other government programs

application_questions.title: Location
questions: Identify the location(s) where the Program, Activities, or Work will take place

application_questions.title: Legal Signing Officers
questions: List of legal signing officers (Title, Name, Is Signature Mandatory?)
Signature Conditions (textarea: how many/which signatures are required)

application_questions.title: Supporting Documents
application_questions.note: The 'Detailed Training Description' likely contains the 10-section proposal outlined in the Guidelines PDF (pages 7-10)

proposal_requirements.format: Narrative document following 10-section structure from Guidelines

sections.title: Executive Summary
subsections: Overview: Brief summary highlighting purpose, objectives, expected impact
Alignment with Priorities: How project aligns with government priorities

sections.title: Project Objectives and Scope
subsections: Specific Goals: Primary goals (skill development, productivity improvement)
Target Audience: Who will benefit (sectors or individual business)
Scope of Work: Key activities, locations, number of participants

sections.title: Project Justification and Need
subsections: Problem Statement: Workforce gap or skill shortage to address
Relevance to Sector Needs: Sector-specific demand or emerging trends
Capacity-Building Focus: How project increases organization's capacity

sections.title: Detailed Project Description
subsections: Activities and Deliverables: Planned activities, deliverables, timelines
Trainer Qualifications and Expertise: Education, experience, certifications, references
Training Methods: Approach (on-site, online, workshops) and rationale
Innovation Elements: New technology, partnerships, novel approaches

sections.title: Expected Outcomes and Impact
subsections: Measurable Outcomes: Specific outcomes (# trained, productivity improvements)
Long-Term Impact: Impact on organization/sector
Alignment with Program Objectives: Link to government goals

sections.title: Evaluation and Measurement Plan
subsections: Success Metrics: Metrics to measure success (skill gains, operational efficiency)
Evaluation Process: How outcomes tracked (data collection, reporting timelines, tools)

sections.title: Project Timeline
subsections: Milestones: Major milestones, deliverables, project schedule
Start and End Dates: Adherence to 12-month funding period

sections.title: Budget and Funding Requirements
subsections: Detailed Budget: Breakdown by line items (training costs, materials, instructor fees, travel)
Funding Request: Amount requested and other funding sources
Cost Justification: How each budget item supports goals and outcomes

sections.title: Organizational Capacity and Expertise
subsections: Project Management Plan: How project managed, team roles and responsibilities

sections.title: Sustainability and Scalability
subsections: Sustainability Plan: How organization maintains benefits over time
Scalability: Could project be scaled or replicated?

scoring.0-5: Does not meet expectations - Lacks clear problem statement, no link to needs, no measurable outcomes
scoring.6-10: Partially meets expectations - Defines problem but lacks depth, some outcomes but no detailed evaluation plan
scoring.11-15: Meets expectations - Clearly articulates problem with evidence, clear quantifiable outcomes, addresses high-demand skills, meaningful partnerships

scoring.0-5: Does not meet - Lacks clear objectives, unrealistic timeline, no logical approach
scoring.6-10: Partially meets - Provides objectives and basic timeline but lacks methodology clarity
scoring.11-15: Meets - SMART objectives with clear, realistic methodology and timeline

criteria.criterion: Fostering Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Accessibility

scoring.0-5: Does not meet - Does not address EDIA or reach to underrepresented groups
scoring.6-10: Partially meets - Some diversity initiatives but lacks structured approach
scoring.11-15: Meets - Strong, actionable EDIA commitment with clear strategies and partnerships

scoring.0-5: Does not meet - Lacks defined outcomes, no business benefits explanation, no measurement plan
scoring.6-10: Partially meets - Outlines outcomes but lacks clarity on immediate benefits or operational integration
scoring.11-15: Meets - Clearly defines immediate business impact, has measurement plan, outlines future potential

criteria.criterion: Fostering Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Accessibility

scoring.0-3: Does not meet - No partnerships or shared resources
scoring.4-6: Meets - Some resource-sharing but lacks full commitment details
scoring.7-10: Exceeds - Well-defined partnerships with financial/in-kind contributions, specified roles and commitments

estimated_time.supporting_documents: 10-20 hours (gathering trainer credentials, creating itemized budget, etc.)

preparation_checklist: ✓ Direct deposit banking information + VOID cheque
✓ Training program start and end dates (must fit 12-month period)
✓ List of participants (or estimated participant profile)

key_insights.two_part_application: The application consists of: (1) Structured data entry in 14-step LaMPSS form, (2) Detailed narrative proposal document following 10-section guidelines
key_insights.proposal_is_critical: The 'Detailed Training Description' document (Step 14) is where the substantive content resides - this is what gets scored using the assessment rubric
key_insights.form_collects_admin_data: Steps 1-13 collect administrative, financial, and logistical data for eligibility verification and payment processing
key_insights.stacking_disclosure: Step 9 asks about other funding sources - relates to restriction on training already funded by other government programs
key_insights.timeline_constraints: Step 12 requires start/end dates within 12-month funding period

must_have: SMART objectives (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound)
Clear problem statement with supporting evidence
Quantifiable outcomes (# employees trained, productivity metrics, etc.)
Evidence of NEW capacity building (not routine professional development)
strong_differentiators: Addresses critical skill shortages in high-demand occupations
Supports underrepresented communities (Indigenous, Black/African Nova Scotian, newcomers, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+, youth, rural workers)
Strategic partnerships with educational institutions or training providers
Clear EDIA (Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility) commitment
common_mistakes: Training for existing role skills (not NEW capacity)
Applying for ineligible activities (conferences, duplicate training)

notes.no_updates_after_submission: Cannot update application after submission - must be complete and accurate before submitting
notes.competitive_assessment: Not all proposals funded - scored competitively, minimum threshold determined by submission quality and available funding
notes.decision_timeline: Not specified in guidelines - assessment duration varies
